children.subject:
From hkn.mu/decalfa19:

"Classes are planned for Mondays 6-8pm in Soda Hall."
when will it be during the week?
Applications for spring 2020 are not out yet, there will probably be a post when they are, you’ll find out about acceptance around the first week of classes.
When will we find out if we've been accepted into the decal or not?

history.content:
Are you interested in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering but not sure what exactly you want to do? The possibilities are almost endless - from machine learning to computer security to integrated circuits - and we know that it may be difficult to decide what path you want to pursue, especially if you haven’t had much experience in these fields. While it may be tempting to blindly choose classes and hope that you will enjoy the subjects, we have another option for you.

 

If you want to explore the diverse world of CS and EE, consider taking HKN’s Going Down the EECS Stack DeCal. This 1-unit course provides a broad survey of the many applications of computer science and electrical engineering, giving a detailed overview and offering hands-on experience for each subject we cover. By taking this class we hope that you will gain a better sense of what areas you might be interested pursuing in-depth, and of the classes and resources at Berkeley which will help further these interests.

 

To apply for the DeCal, please fill out the form at hkn.mu/decalapp.

The official course listing can be found at hkn.mu/decalfa19. If you have any questions, please email decal@hkn.eecs.berkeley.edu. This DeCal is open to all majors and years, and no prior EE or CS experience is required. The Going Down the EECS Stack DeCal is student-taught, and although some instructors may be members of course staff for various courses, the DeCal has no affiliation with courses in the EECS department.
